{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Surface Transportation Board Reauthorization Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Surface Transportation Board Reauthorization Act of 2014

shall promulgate regulations to establish a binding arbitration process to resolve rail
			 rate, practice, and common carrier service
			 expectation complaints subject to the jurisdiction of the

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the
The binding arbitration process—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; and

text.#text:
shall apply to disputes involving rates, practices, and common carrier service expectations subject
			 to the jurisdiction of the
shall not apply to—

disputes to obtain the grant, denial, stay, or revocation of any license, authorization, or
			 exemption, or to prescribe for the future any conduct, rules, or results
			 of
			 general, industry-wide applicability, or to enforce a labor protective
			 condition; and
disputes solely between 2 or more rail carriers.
The
may make the binding arbitration process available only to the relevant parties—
after the filing of a formal complaint; or

Any decision reached in an arbitration process under this section—
shall—
be consistent with subtitle IV;
be in writing;
contain findings of fact and conclusions; and
be binding upon the parties; and
shall not have any precedential effect in any other or subsequent arbitration dispute.

text.#text:
An arbitrator or panel of arbitrators shall be selected not later than 14 days after the date of
			 the

The evidentiary process of the binding arbitration process shall be completed not later than 90
			 days after
			 the date that the arbitration process is initiated, unless a party
			 requests an extension and the arbitrator or panel of arbitrators, as
			 applicable, grants it.

The arbitrator or panel of arbitrators, as applicable, shall issue a decision not later than 30
			 days after the date that the evidentiary
			 record is closed.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may extend any of the timelines in this subsection upon the agreement of all parties in

			 regulation, professional or business experience, including agriculture, in

text.#text:
Arbitration under this section shall be conducted by an arbitrator, or a panel of arbitrators,
			 selected from a roster,
			 maintained by the

If the parties cannot
			 mutually agree on an arbitrator, or the lead arbitrator of a panel of
			 arbitrators, the parties
			 shall select the arbitrator
			 or lead arbitrator from
			 the roster by alternately striking names from the roster until only 1 name
			 remains.

Notwithstanding subparagraph (A), each party to a dispute shall select 1 arbitrator from the
			 roster.

The parties to a dispute may mutually select 1 arbitrator from the roster to serve as the lead
			 arbitrator of the panel of arbitrators.
For purposes of this section, a panel of arbitrators shall be selected as follows:

The parties shall share the costs of the arbitration
			 equally.

An arbitral decision under this section may award the payment of damages or rate prescriptive
			 relief, but the
			 value of the award shall be limited as follows:
For common carrier service and practice disputes, the damage award may not exceed $2,000,000.

For rate disputes, the damage award, including any rate prescription, may not exceed $25,000,000,
			 and any rate prescription shall be limited to not longer than 5 years from
			 the date of the arbitral decision.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the

may review the decision
			 under
			 this section to determine if—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; or

text.#text: the decision is consistent with subtitle IV as applied by the
the award limitation under subsection (g).
